{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3144416,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-12T23:08:22.124Z","cooked":"

I’ve playing around with engraving logos with our CNC router and filling them with paint. My goal is to get crisp details in polycarbonate using something’s that will survive 4-5 in season competitions and 3-4 off seasons.

So far the engraving has been easy, but I’m having trouble finding a paint that is durable, fills nicely and can either be cleaned off the surface or squeegeed into the grooves cleanly. We have tried several fabric paints, acrylics, nail polish, tempera.

Anyone else had any luck with this? Paint recommendations?

image1920×2560 415 KB

Have you tried testers enamel paint?

you could try using a vinyl cutter and making vinyl stickers that go into the engraving

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-02-12T23:21:40.186Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":262,"readers_count":261,"score":57.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":426628,"topic_slug":"cnc-engraving","display_username":"Connor C","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50835,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2830m | 8177a"},"post_url":"/t/cnc-engraving/426628/3","custom_user_title":"2830m | 8177a","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3144458,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-13T00:36:11.820Z","cooked":"

This is good stuff. I use it for miniature painting. Bonus points for coming in a million colors and being like 2$ a bottle.

There are also several grades of engravers wax that may produce the desired results, but color may be a problem.

Another option may be to engrave the mirror image on the backside, so the paint shows thru and it is more protected

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-02-13T00:37:58.812Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":242,"readers_count":241,"score":68.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":426628,"topic_slug":"cnc-engraving","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":18204,"username":"itsjustmrb","name":"Brad Billeaudeau FRC Team 4206","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/f19dbf/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/cnc-engraving/426628/4","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3144462,"name":"Britt C","username":"Britt","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/britt/{size}/240089_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-13T00:40:14.176Z","cooked":"

or better yet just vinyl stickers unless you are really looking for that depth. they are super easy to apply and will last more than a season, our robot from 2016 still looks almost as fresh as it did at the end of the season.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-02-13T00:40:14.176Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":218,"readers_count":217,"score":68.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":426628,"topic_slug":"cnc-engraving","display_username":"Britt C","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":50835,"username":"Connor-8177","name":"Connor C","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/connor-8177/{size}/234521_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33908,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4488 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/cnc-engraving/426628/5","custom_user_title":"4488 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3144468,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-13T01:02:58.058Z","cooked":"

One of the samples is Testers actually, its really nice except that it didn’t squeegee very well, too sticky. We could try to careful fill in the logos, but my hope was to be able to use this for sponsor panels with very small fiddly details so if we can’t fill and squeegee it would be hours of painting. That’s one of the reasons we are trying to avoid vinyl, we have a vinyl cutter but weeding out certain logos is a massive pain. Ideally we want to be able to do this in house, but might out source the stickers.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-02-13T01:02:58.058Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":196,"readers_count":195,"score":59.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":426628,"topic_slug":"cnc-engraving","display_username":"Patrick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52597,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Build mentor"},"post_url":"/t/cnc-engraving/426628/6","custom_user_title":"Build mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3144478,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-13T01:36:34.238Z","cooked":"
Patrick3357:

too sticky

Testors thins out quite well with mineral spirits. I am not positive what you mean by sticky, that could mean a few things, thinning may not be your problem.

Side note I do not know what mineral spirits do to polycarb. so… solvents, yeah!

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-02-13T01:37:56.780Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":179,"readers_count":178,"score":40.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":426628,"topic_slug":"cnc-engraving","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/cnc-engraving/426628/7","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3144483,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-13T01:55:27.146Z","cooked":"

Sticky is such a wonderful word, it sounds like it means something, but I certainly don’t know of any quantifiable definition. I never paid too much attention in fluid mechanics, but I think the ideal paint would be high viscosity (thick), but with very low shear. Unscientifically, “thick” paint sits in the grooves which is good, sticky paint leaves residue on the surface of the polycarb when squeegeed off which ruins the appearance.

One of the paints we tried was a cheap old acrylic that had started drying out so after we removed the dried out paint from the cap we had quite thick paint but it was slippery so it squeegeed off really well.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-02-13T01:55:27.146Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":62.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":426628,"topic_slug":"cnc-engraving","display_username":"Patrick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52597,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Build mentor"},"post_url":"/t/cnc-engraving/426628/8","custom_user_title":"Build mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3144553,"name":"seamushroom","username":"seamushroom","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/278dde/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-13T05:04:51.598Z","cooked":"

wondering if maybe a slightly damp sponge would be more helpful than a squeegee. you can dampen with either H20 or another solvent. Another potential option might be to put a layer of masking tape or painters tape over the polycarb before engraving to act as a mask. Then paint with the mask still on, and remove it once the paint has dried. The big drawback there is that you will get adhesive sticking to your endmill.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-02-13T05:04:51.598Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":132,"readers_count":131,"score":81.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":426628,"topic_slug":"cnc-engraving","display_username":"seamushroom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23491,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Technical Mentor - 2491"},"post_url":"/t/cnc-engraving/426628/9","custom_user_title":"Technical Mentor - 2491","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3144603,"name":"Ian McTavish","username":"Ian_McTavish","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/b5a626/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-13T13:06:25.972Z","cooked":"

Use a vinyl drag knife to cut the mask, put the vinyl on the part, spraypaint, remove the vinyl when dry. End result looks great.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-02-13T13:06:25.972Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":103,"readers_count":102,"score":20.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":426628,"topic_slug":"cnc-engraving","display_username":"Ian McTavish","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":23491,"username":"seamushroom","name":"seamushroom","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/278dde/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17356,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cnc-engraving/426628/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3152490,"name":"","username":"Brandonm","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/b4bc9f/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-25T14:00:32.411Z","cooked":"

How about taking wide masking tape and applying to the surface of the part before putting in the cnc machine, then do the cnc work so straight from cnc you can pour/apply/squeeze in the filler paint and set aside to cure and then peel the masking tape off

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-02-25T14:00:32.411Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":55,"readers_count":54,"score":26.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":426628,"topic_slug":"cnc-engraving","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/cnc-engraving/426628/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3152910,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-26T03:35:19.151Z","cooked":"

We didn’t try masking tape, but we did try leaving the film on the plastic but it came up on the small details.
